properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-24T17:59:47-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system moving through Hudson Bay will bring 10 to 15 cm of snow to Coral Harbour. Snow began this morning in Coral Harbour and 10 cm of snow is expected during the day. Snow will likely be heavy at times and may result in reduced visibilities. Snowfall will taper off Sunday night and a few additional centimeters of snow are expected by Monday morning. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-25T06:15:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T14:16:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2642146720.2020
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Showers and a few thunderstorms will be locally heavy this afternoon. An area of showers with thunderstorms is expected to continue or develop near Sarnia or east of Goderich this afternoon. These showers and storms will likely remain north of London and move east to northeastward through the afternoon. Heavy downpours giving rain amounts locally up to 25 millimetres are possible. Impacts may be reduced visibility while driving and ponding water on roads. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-25T03:16:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T15:21:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1037133030.2020
Area: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County, Sarnia - Petrolia - Western Lambton County, London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, Strathroy - Komoka - Western Middlesex County, Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County, Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: plus 1 to plus 5. Locations: most of Nova Scotia, including Cape Breton Island. Time span: Overnight and early Monday morning. Remarks: A combination of clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for patchy frost formation tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-25T05:50:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T13:51:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3226718085.2020
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. Location: West Porters Lake near exit 19 of Highway 107 An active forest fire near Highway 107 exit 19 is producing smoke and reduced air quality near the surface. Light westerly winds this morning will increase to southwest 20 km/h this afternoon and will likely cause the smoke plume to drift later in the day. Highway 107 remains closed between exits 18 and 20 and an Evacuation Comfort Centre has been established at the Lake Echo Community Centre for those in need of assistance. ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-05-24T22:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness, 2020-05-24T13:52:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0937549368.2020
Area: Halifax Metro and Halifax County West
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Frost and freeze conditions will develop overnight into Sunday morning as temperatures fall to near freezing. Milder temperatures are expected Sunday night. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-24T17:59:06-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. A dense area of fog has developed over Kugluktuk. Fog will become less extensive this evening. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-25T06:29:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-24T14:30:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0500983361.2020
Area: Kugluktuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada
